Episodes.Title: Mafia Cops: Louis Eppolito and Stephen Caracappa
Episodes.Plot: In the 1980s, New York City cops Louis Eppolito and Stephen Caracappa were secretly working as hired guns for the Mafia in a scheme that would go down as the worst case of police corruption in NYPD history.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Lightbox Provisional Classification. Official NZ Rating To Be Confirmed.

Episodes.Title: Danny Greene
Episodes.Plot: Fashioning himself a modern-day Celtic warrior, 1970's Irish mobster Danny Greene clashed with the Cleveland mafia, resulting in a bombing war that would eventually destroy them both.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Violence & content that may disturb

Episodes.Title: Albert Anastasia
Episodes.Plot: As leader of Murder, Inc., Albert Anastasia was one of the most vicious and feared mob bosses of the twentieth century.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Lightbox Provisional Classification. Official NZ Rating To Be Confirmed.

Episodes.Title: Tommy "Karate" Pitera
Episodes.Plot: Tommy Pitera became one of the most violent men of all time in the 1980's; betrayal brought the mob killer to justice.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Lightbox Provisional Classification. Official NZ Rating To Be Confirmed.

Episodes.Title: Anthony "Gaspipe" Casso
Episodes.Plot: During the 1970s, Anthony "Gaspipe" Casso rose through the ranks of the New York Mafia to become underboss of the Lucchese family, raking in millions of dollars through elaborate scams and killing anyone who got in his way.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: M Violence,offensive language and content that may disturb
